segment.source: Browser cache changes and roaming profiles
segment.target: Browser cache changes and roaming profiles

segment.source: Browser cache changes and roaming profiles (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Browser cache changes and roaming profiles (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Browser cache changes and roaming profiles
segment.target: Browser cache changes and roaming profiles

segment.source: We’ve redesigned the browser cache to improve the performance, flexibility, reliability, and scalability of Internet Explorer and the apps that rely on the Windows Internet (WinINet) cache.
segment.target: We’ve redesigned the browser cache to improve the performance, flexibility, reliability, and scalability of Internet Explorer and the apps that rely on the Windows Internet (WinINet) cache.

segment.source: Our new database design stops multiple clients from simultaneously accessing and using cached information, while also providing a higher level of data integrity.
segment.target: Our new database design stops multiple clients from simultaneously accessing and using cached information, while also providing a higher level of data integrity.

segment.source: You won’t notice any changes to the management of your roaming profile data if you use our new database implementation in conjunction with the roaming user profile guidelines.
segment.target: You won’t notice any changes to the management of your roaming profile data if you use our new database implementation in conjunction with the roaming user profile guidelines.

segment.source: This means that IE data that’s stored in the user profile folder is still be uploaded to your normal profile storage location after a user successfully logs off.
segment.target: This means that IE data that’s stored in the user profile folder is still be uploaded to your normal profile storage location after a user successfully logs off.

segment.source: Cookies in a roaming profile can only be set by Internet Explorer for the desktop, with Enhanced Protected Mode turned off.
segment.target: Cookies in a roaming profile can only be set by Internet Explorer for the desktop, with Enhanced Protected Mode turned off.

segment.source: Cookies set by the immersive version of IE or by Windows Store apps, can’t be part of a roaming profile.
segment.target: Cookies set by the immersive version of IE or by Windows Store apps, can’t be part of a roaming profile.

segment.source: For more information about persistent cookies and roaming, see Persistent cookies are not roamed in Internet Explorer.
segment.target: For more information about persistent cookies and roaming, see Persistent cookies are not roamed in Internet Explorer.

segment.source: To get the best results while using roaming profiles, we strongly recommend the following:
segment.target: To get the best results while using roaming profiles, we strongly recommend the following:

segment.source: Create a separate roaming repository for each domain account that uses roaming.
segment.target: Create a separate roaming repository for each domain account that uses roaming.

segment.source: Restrict roaming user profiles so they work on only one computer at a time.
segment.target: Restrict roaming user profiles so they work on only one computer at a time.

segment.source: Using a single roaming profile on multiple computers isn’t supported (via console or Remote Desktop) and can cause unpredictable results, including cookie loss.
segment.target: Using a single roaming profile on multiple computers isn’t supported (via console or Remote Desktop) and can cause unpredictable results, including cookie loss.

segment.source: Allow all computers that let users sign-on with a roaming profile have identical IE cookie policies and settings.
segment.target: Allow all computers that let users sign-on with a roaming profile have identical IE cookie policies and settings.

segment.source: Make sure to delete the user’s local roaming profile at sign off for any computer using user profile roaming.
segment.target: Make sure to delete the user’s local roaming profile at sign off for any computer using user profile roaming.

segment.source: You can do this by turning on the Delete cached copies of roaming profiles Group Policy Object.
segment.target: You can do this by turning on the Delete cached copies of roaming profiles Group Policy Object.
